We were looking for an extended weekend getaway in a nice, quiet place, and Tyler's place checked all the boxes. This 120 year old home is oozing with character - each room distinctive, tastefully decorated, and just a really comfortable space. We especially liked spending time on the wide front porch, just watching the occasional person pass.
The house is two blocks away from the grocery, a nice pub, a great sandwich shop, and a bakery. It was easy to get around both by car and on foot.
Tyler has decorated the house with a huge collection of Purdue memorabilia - a nifty treat if you're an alumnus or a fan of the university - yet tasteful enough to not offend your sensibilities if you root for that other school.
We were particularly impressed by how quiet the place was. Despite the bedrooms being at the front of the house, traffic noise didn't disturb our sleep - the house itself has good sound isolation, and the road isn't terribly busy, despite being near everything.
Tyler prepared lots of helpful documentation on the area and the house itself. Communication was great. Very easy and relaxing stay. We'll definitely look to stay here next time we're in Delphi.

Where to begin... OK - let me start at the beginning. Tyler responds almost within seconds, any time you ask questions. The check-in process was easy peasy.
And then there's that house. Oh my gosh - to be able to stay in an historic home like Sterling House is such a privilege. Tyler has furnished it with fabulous antiques (be sure to check out the round desk in the upstairs turret). We enjoyed every part of the house, though we found ourselves using the library, kitchen table, and front porch as the spots to visit with friends and drink our coffee and wine.
The house is spotless, and Tyler provides plenty of fluffy towels and amenities in the bathrooms and kitchen to make your stay easy.
The location of this home couldn't be better. We could walk three blocks to the Brick and Mortar Pub and the Delphi Opera House Gallery and the shops in downtown Delphi. There's always plenty of parking on the street in front of the house, in addition to the two spots at the side.
Let me point out two aspects that make this particular house so special. Tyler is a Delphi guy who loves his community, and it really shows in the photos and artwork by local artists displayed in his house. In addition, he has an extensive collection of books about local history which he offers in the lovely library. You can't help but feel the history of this small town.
Which brings me to the second "plus:" this gorgeous historic home sits among many gorgeous (or becoming gorgeous or potentially gorgeous) historic homes. Sit on the front porch and look across the street at the transformation going on at a Victorian mansion and at a beautiful example of mid-century limestone ranch homes situated on a 3-acre wooded lot. Walk around the neighborhood and see example after example of classic architecture.
Delphi is a lovely historic town with many attractions - the Opera House and Gallery, the Wabash and Erie Canal Center, the Historic Hiking Trails, Riley Park, Deer Creek; and Sterling House is a perfect home base for exploring and getting a feel for this charming community. I definitely will return to Sterling House (and I'll bring friends!). I highly highly recommend it. Well done, Tyler.
